body.p: The menus are located at the top of the application window. They contain all the commands necessary for creating, editing and publishing documents.
The menus may differ depending on whether there is an opened document or not as well as on the type of the opened document and the authoring mode.

fig.title: DITA Topic menus in the WYSIWYG mode.

body.p: To open a menu, click it or use the Alt-accelerator. For example, to open the DITA menu, press Alt-I.

The Document Open Recent menu item shows the list of the last 9 opened documents. When you move the mouse pointer over an item on the list, a tooltip is shown providing the Filename, Stylesheet and Schema information.

fig.title: Open Recent list. A tooltip shows the paths to the file, stylesheet and Schema.
